item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ª Former President Donald Trump has declared a looming confrontation with drug trafficking from Latin America, which will involve land operations, extending beyond just Venezuela. He asserts that 96% of drugs transported by water have been intercepted, shifting the emphasis to land routes. In response, Venezuelan Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino LÃ³pez stated that surrender is not an option and accused the U.S. of attempting to dominate the Caribbean. Colombian President Gustavo Petro has cautioned that U.S. military actions on Colombian territory could escalate into war. max

item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ European Council President AntÃ³nio Costa has declared that Russian assets that have been frozen in the EU will stay blocked until the conflict in Ukraine concludes and Russia pays for the damages caused. Analysts suggest that this decision is intended to strengthen the EUâ€™s bargaining position and facilitate the confiscation of funds for reparations to Ukraine. However, Italy, Belgium, Malta, and Bulgaria are against outright confiscation and propose an alternative solution involving EU joint debt to support Ukraine, according to Politico. max

item.description: ğŸ’¥ The United States has lifted sanctions on the Belarusian potash producer Belaruskalij, as announced by Trump's special representative, John Kohl, after two days of discussions with U.S. envoy John Kohl. In exchange, Alexander Lukashenko freed 123 prisoners. Belaruskalij is among the largest producers and exporters of potash fertilizers, responsible for 20% of the global market, according to the International Fertilizer Association. max

item.description: âš ï¸ Ukraine and Geopolitics: Kyiv has sent a peace plan to Washington that rejects the withdrawal of troops from Donbas and the abandonment of NATO membership, according to the NYT. Zelensky is set to meet with representatives of Trump soon and has announced Ukraine's largest sanctions package targeting Russia's shadow fleet. For more information, visit Max.

He highlighted that Americans are now more assertively pursuing their own interests, and Europeans need to adopt a similar approach. "Pax Americana" denotes the time of relative peace and US dominance following World War II. For further information, click here.

item.title: âš ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Geopolitical analysts indicate that Zelensky and European leaders are strategically positioning...
item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Geopolitical analysts indicate that Zelensky and European leaders are strategically positioning themselves to endure until the conclusion of Trump's presidency. They anticipate that negotiations with the U.S. could take time, believing there is a possibility to bring an end to the conflict. European nations perceive Trump as a "lame duck" and are biding their time for his departure. Meanwhile, the Trump administration continues to supply arms to Ukraine and European allies through NATO. As we approach 2026, the implications of the U.S. elections and the direction of MAGA Republicans will become increasingly significant. The situation is fluid. source

item.title: âš ï¸ Zelensky is looking to modify Trump's peace plan to make it more acceptable for Ukraine without e...
item.description: âš ï¸ Zelensky is looking to modify Trump's peace plan to make it more acceptable for Ukraine without explicitly rejecting it, according to the WSJ. He noted that the U.S. has not yet responded to Ukraine's latest proposals. Ushakov mentioned that Russia has not reviewed the proposals from the EU and Ukraine. Zelensky highlighted that the plan will require compromises. The Kremlin has criticized NATO Secretary-General Rutte. Meanwhile, Zelensky is also preparing for potential elections. The Kremlin is insisting on guarantees if any peace agreements are reached. Zelensky stated that if negotiations fail, alternative solutions must be explored.

item.title: âš ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ After a record autumn of investments, international investors have begun to cash in on large te...
item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ After a record autumn of investments, international investors have begun to cash in on large tech stocks this December. Since the start of the month, there has been a net outflow of $1.6 billion, marking the highest figure of the year. Concerns about a potential "AI bubble" and the timeline for future Federal Reserve rate cuts are significant factors. Wall Street strategists recommend focusing on less trendy sectors such as health care, industrials, and energy. For further details, check out BofA|EPFR and Bloomberg. Discover more at max.

item.title: âš ï¸ğŸ’£ Recent transmissions from the radio station UVB-76, often referred to as the "Doomsday Radio Sta...
item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ’£ Recent transmissions from the radio station UVB-76, often referred to as the "Doomsday Radio Station," have sparked concerns in the West. In the last week, it has sent out as many as 15 enigmatic messages, fueling anxieties about a possible third world war. Phrases such as "pepper shaker," "re-hiring," and "outlawed" were among those broadcast. Typically, the frequency of these coded communications tends to rise during times of global crises, which has heightened fears of conflict this week, according to the British tabloid Express. max
